website_summaries.verdict: A basic, capable food processor for those on a budget.
pros: Easy to use and convenient to store
cons: A small percentage of product failures

website_summaries.verdict: Go with this unit if you use a food processor regularly and you want a heavy-duty model that can accommodate a lot of food at once.
pros: Large storage bowl with pour spout
S-blade and shred and slice disc included
Easy to attach and detach the bowl from the unit
Suction cup feet hold it in place
cons: A few users say liquids can splash out because the lid is not watertight

customer_reviews.title: This is a great food processor, just make sure you get the right size for you.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great food processor, but I wish we had purchased a smaller one. If you are making a lot of food, this processor works amazing, but if you just want to make a little guac or something to go with a small dinner, it doesn't work at all. It just kind of smashes the food to the side, and never really chops it up. If you add more food to it, it works great. Just make sure you get the size that best applies to you.
customer_reviews.author: B-Rad

customer_reviews.title: My wife loves it
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally melted the plastic container for my wife's last food processor in the dishwasher and had to find a replacement since she was not particularly happy about me melting the first one. I found this one online and she loves it, though I don't put it in the dishwasher. I am not sure if it would survive or not but I am not willing to take that chance. It has several different settings and lots of equipment to process any food that you want.
customer_reviews.author: Myron TTop Contributor: Lego

customer_reviews.title: Snap is correct
customer_reviews.text: Snap is correct. I have used about 4 times and the hinged lid locking arm is missing an essential piece that holds the lid securely and allows for operation of the processor. I do not use if for anything other than vegetables and not in large quantities. I didn't buy it for heavy use and the price seemed reasonable. This was not worth it. 8/26/17 update. The plastic lid is made of a brittle plastic. I accidentally dropped the lid from a height of about 3 feet onto a vinyl floor and the hinge snapped in half. Dropping something from that height onto a softer surface should not have resulted in the break. I would not recommend for frequent use.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: What a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this food processor in aug 2016. however, just started using it 5 weeks ago, to mash my childs vegetables, Today, after only 1 month of use, it broke. The knife would not turn anymore. My husband tried to see whats wrong and wasn't able to fix it, because the insert, that catches the nut is cracked. Warranty is only valid for 1 year after date of purchase. I have to trash it and buy a new one. What a waste of money :((
customer_reviews.author: marion gaston

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this food processor!
customer_reviews.text: The item as a whole is great, BUT, you can't clean it thoroughly. There is a space on the top near the handle that food gets caught. You can't flush it out You can't get a pipe cleaner, or other item, into this space to clean out stuck food particles. I've had food mold in there because I couldn't get it out. How is this sanitary. If I could get my money back at this late date, I send it back in a heart beat.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea, Bad in Design Details.
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, however small but important design details make this one product one I wish I had not bought. The chopping blade is super sharp (a good thing) but there is little to no pitch of the blade to circulate the cuttings. I was chopping cabbage and once the bottom was filed the blade failed to Circulate the cabbage leaving large pieces on the top. The slicing blade cuts slices too thin for dipping. Too thin for pickles and about the only thing It is good for is making a salad. The grating blade works well but there are large pieces of green pepper, carrots, ect... on top of the blade which need to be removed and grated by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s actually 9 cups, not 12.
customer_reviews.text: I did not test it, so this review has nothing to do with how it actually works. I just received it, and it looked small. So we used a measuring cup to measure the size, and it came out to 9 cups. Not 12. Very misleading. I’m returning it. If I wanted a 9 cup food processor, I would’ve bought a 9 cup one.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Strebel

customer_reviews.title: Very concerning! Use your judement!
customer_reviews.text: So the POS are it's a great food processor! Very powerful easy to assemble. Nice looking. CONS.... Being a clean freak. This is extremely hard to clean! A very long time actually. All in all I'm VERY CONCERNED that water doesn't escape the tube nor certain parts of the lid. I have an allergy to mold. So again it took me FOREVER to clean. So it's concerning. Use your own judgement please. Not sure if I'm going to keep it yet. Solely due to the water getting stuck. Also because of the time it took me to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Boom Boom POW

customer_reviews.title: Slight Cleaning Dilemma
customer_reviews.text: Processor works great and is easy to clean, with *ONE* exception. Occasionally food scraps will become stuck in lid's tube (adjacent to pusher and just above the spring). There's absolutely no way to disassemble this component to reach and remove food. I imagine over time the ort will disintegrate and disappear, but that doesn't seem very hygienic!
customer_reviews.author: R WARNAS

customer_reviews.title: Been very reliable
customer_reviews.text: Got this to make hot sauce since the old lady didn’t want me spicing up her fancy cuisinart. This thing makes short work of whatever I throw in. Gets my sauce a nice smooth consistency. The only thing I haven’t liked so far is getting the purée blades cleaned. Inside the hub where the blade slides onto the axle, there’s a lot of tiny spaces between plastic. Looks like it’s there for structural strength. Food gets inside them and I have to take special care to clean it out before putting in the dishwasher or it won’t be clean. It’s not terrible though, just a little annoying. Overall I love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Beynon

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY! Doesn't Do what it should at this price
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I are avid cooks. We had an inexpensive, no frills kitchen aid food processor for 5 years and used it daily. The motor eventually burned out, but we put it through a lot. We felt like we got our money’s worth and more. We decided that we wanted to spend more money for a better food processor that we could use to do it all. This one by Hamilton Beach IS TERRIBLE. It doesn't chop evenly or coarse enough and it certainly doesn't puree. I will never purchase another Hamilton Beach product again.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as my old GEModel 45 years old!
customer_reviews.text: I am soooooo disappointed in this food processor! I was looking forward to having a new and improved processor after 45 years with the same GE processor. Now I wish I had not given away my old model so quickly! This new processor doesn't purée as good as the old one, and my shredded cabbage for slaw is not as finely shredded as with my old model. Not happy!
customer_reviews.author: Alice Betts

customer_reviews.title: Well, I was very excited when I first purchased ...
customer_reviews.text: Well, I was very excited when I first purchased this. The cheese grater was magnificent. However, I haven't had it for that long and cheese tends to get stuck in the lip of it as it grates, and also the top tends to pop up leaving me with ungrated chunks. Not sure if I got a defective one or if these are general problems with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Strauther

customer_reviews.title: Safety Mechanism Plastic Part Broke
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, just after the expiration of the warranty (1 year) the plastic part on the handle, that is required for the safety mechanism to unlock, broke. We tried fixing this with superglue once but it just does not hold together anymore. Everything else worked fine but is useless with this part being broken. It's quite a waste and very upsetting, considering that all other parts still work fine. Durability (in this case) weighs in more than any other feature since it is just dysfunctional now.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Angst

customer_reviews.title: This is a good food processor at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This is a good food processor at a great price. It was rated high on Amazon feedback, as well as product comparison sites. Sadly, if you make nut butters, this is probably not the blender for you. My nut butters are not as smooth as my previous food processor. Because of the price, I only knocked it down one star instead of two. It would have influenced my purchase had I known. One joy for me is that my previous food processor couldn't shred cheese without breaking the bowl (seriously!! - food processors 101), so I'm happy to be able to shred cheese again. It's a sturdy appliance.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Basics at best.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift for my mother and finally had the opportunity to put it to use. Extremely disappointing. It’s great to chop nuts for baking but that’s it. Tried shredding cheese and the gap between the lid and the blade was too large and the cheese just spun around. Then attempted to blend butter into flour for a pastry dough and it just stirred the butter in the flour. No blending at all. I ended up using a hand pastry blending tool from 1950 which worked far better. If you do more in your kitchen than microwave food - look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very flimsy
customer_reviews.text: This food processor worked for about a week then it would shut down at will. Additionally, it is very flimsy, all parts seem to be made of thin plastic and are ready to break or chip. Spend a little more money and get a better one if you can afford it, otherwise, this is a roll of the dice, some like it, some don't. Generally speaking, if you plan to use it at least once a week, get a higher quality unit.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie A. Maalouf

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after one use.
customer_reviews.text: Bought October 1, 2016. Used it to make Thanksgiving dinner 11/2016. Worked like a charm. Put it away and next time I needed was Thanksgiving dinner 2018. Pulled it out and does not turn on. Big disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Replacement parts are obsolete as of March 2019
customer_reviews.text: Purchased it seven months ago parts are now obsolete as of March 2019 yet the mixer still for sale lead is made out of exceptionally brittle thin plastic. It reminded me of an antique glass Christmas ball as it exploded on my kitchen floor what good is a $50 mixer that's 7 months old when I can't purchase a replacement part
customer_reviews.author: oilreclaimer!

customer_reviews.title: Louder, cheaper and doesn't work as well as my Cuisinart Custom Food Prep 11 Did
customer_reviews.text: Louder, cheaper and doesn't work as well as my Cuisinart Custom Food Prep 11 did. This thing is loud. Way loud. It doesn't work at all if you have less an 1 cup of ingredients in the bowl, whereas my Cuisinart (same size bowl) had no issues with 1/2 cup or even a little less of ingredients. It doesn't work well even with more ingredients and it takes twice as long to processes. I don't know what I expected for $50 versus $150, but I regret the decision to buy this as a replacement to my Cuisinart which broke after 20 years now.
customer_reviews.author: sporting road

customer_reviews.title: It did not do a good job of slicing cucumbers
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for 2 days and have only used it twice. It worked fantastically for cauliflower to make cauliflower pizza crust. It did not do a good job of slicing cucumbers, carrots, and bell peppers; they were very uneven and so thin that they just fell apart. I would have tried more things in it, but it got chunks of food stuck in the handle. When I attempted to get them out (which is apparently impossible), the two clips at the top of the spring loaded area in the handle just snapped off. Now I feel that it's potentially unsafe to use. I will be returning this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer13

customer_reviews.title: Makes dough quickly
customer_reviews.text: Decided to get a food processor since it can mix dough along with other things. We needed a quick way to blend cold butter with flour to create the dough for making egg tarts. The buttons were self explanatory on what they were used for. We mainly used the pulse button to incorporate the butter and flour together. This food processor did the job perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: HF

customer_reviews.title: More China garbage that doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Well, I knew it was too good to be true. I bought this to replace an expensive one that stopped working and wouldn't you know it, bought almost year ago and only used twice and it no longer works. WTF. This cheap crap from China seems to be made to breakdown so you have to keep buying. I'm very disgusted and about done with buying any China Made product. It's garbage.
customer_reviews.author: KA54

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t chop well
customer_reviews.text: Worse food processor I’ve ever owned. I’ve owned lots of different food processors but this one has to be the worse one. It doesn’t chop well, everything gets stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Dilenia Del Carmen Almonte

customer_reviews.title: Pleased for the most part
customer_reviews.text: For the most part I am very happy with this Food Processor. Easy to put together ...Easy to clean ... Easy to use. My only complaint and it is my own fault for failure to research different Food Processors. Is the opening where you add your food to process is not very big. To slice potatoes you have to cut the potatoes into smaller pieces which do not yield very big slices. Other than that I love all other aspects of this processor.
customer_reviews.author: L Cook

customer_reviews.title: Onetime wonder.... Worked only once and caput
customer_reviews.text: Bog purchase for my Mom, used it once, only tiny peppers, and ... stopped working. Get yourself another one, anyone but this one...
customer_reviews.author: Anil Patel

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 5 months
customer_reviews.text: It was a great food processor for the price while it lasted. Eventually the engage mechanism in the bowl stopped working. I contacted Amazon, and they provided 800 numbers. After leaving a message, asking for a callback, searching the web site, sending an email, and racking up many hours on hold with customer support, and then searching for replacement parts, I'm left with no option other than throwing it in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Candice Welner

customer_reviews.title: Only works if you push down on the top
customer_reviews.text: I bought one and it lasted 3 1/2 years then quit. I bought this new one for substantially more and it only works if you push down on the top. The microswitch is faulty but we've got to have a food processor. It was a good one before, but then the motor quit. Thought this would be the same but it is no longer a one hand machine. Too toughly packed to repack and send back. Less and less quality from Hamilton Beach.
customer_reviews.author: Mike at the solar home

customer_reviews.title: not strong or durable at all
customer_reviews.text: I had no problem with the first time I used it and made some delicious date balls. However second time, its blades kept getting stuck with the cauliflower florets I was trying to chop. I thought I cut the cauliflowers too big for the blades to operate. I made them smaller but still no success. If the blades/engines are not strong enough, why do you advertise it as a chopper/slicer?? So disappointing...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: design is lacking
customer_reviews.text: The power and function are great. The issue is in the lid locking system and the handle safety mechanism. the lid latches should be replaced with a standard twist lock lid. My lid fell off the drying rack and broke one of the latches. What I believe to be a "safety feature" in the handle design actually limits usability (you have to have the chute insert in for the machine to run). With the Chute insert in your are only left with about a 2 inch diamater opening to feed food into the processor. also the mechanics of the handle design make cleaning it impossible.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: Freakin' Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I have made pizza dough, cut, sliced, grated just about anything I used to cut up in large quantities and it is a HUGE time saver. Very easy to clean. Large enough hole to take any veggie. Cole slaw, home fries, sliced cukes for a party salad, just about anything. Not super heavy but has suction cup feet that are just enough to keep it from sliding. This thing is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Toon88

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy safety feature on the bowl breaks, rendering the machine useless
customer_reviews.text: While this processor works fine, there's a flimsy plastic piece that is built into the bowl's handle. For the machine to work, you must clamp the top onto the bowl, and this presses the plastic piece itself into the base unit. Only then will the motor engage the blade. This is a safety feature designed to ensure that you don't activate the blades without the bowl's top in place. Good idea; faulty design, because the plastic piece breaks easily during routine use, forcing you to buy a new $30 bowl which has the same faulty design.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Maher

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this product!
customer_reviews.text: I have never had a food processor before but I can't imagine not having one now! This has really held up since I have owned it and I highly recommend it. It is a little loud but since I don't use it as often as other kitchen gadgets it doesn't bother me. It does a fantastic job chopping, slicing, and pureeing food! The blades are sharp and get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel Elia

customer_reviews.title: SILENT.  EASY TO LOAD & UNLOAD.  EASY TO OPERATE.
customer_reviews.text: This processor runs quietly and is easy to put together and take apart. I love that only one blade is needed to both slice and shred. However, food gets stuck in the lid just behind the opening of the food chute which is aggravating to remove. I am considering filling the area with hot glue to close it up. Too bad the manufacturers didn't correct this flaw. Otherwise, I am enjoying the food processor and it seems to be worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: T. McTier

customer_reviews.title: Bought less than a month ago. The puree button is malfunctioning.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this a grand total of five times since I bought it barely a month ago. It was functioning well the first four times but just this afternoon, I used it to mix something for desert and noticed the puree button wasn't engaging. This after much care was taken in its use, clean-up and storage. If I can return it, I would in a heartbeat but since I've been on an ordering binge with Amazon, my place is too full of boxes so I had to get rid of the packaging for this blender as soon as I determined it was working the day it arrived. Very, very, very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bella Nya

customer_reviews.title: Total Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I bought a cheap food processor six years ago and it worked great until I recently burned the cover. I was hoping for the same or better performance with this one. To my disappointment, the material is cheap. It only works after several adjustments to the food placed inside and you have to keep pressing the button until it is finished. If you raise your hand up, you have to open, readjust before you press again. It is time consuming, it does not cut as efficiently as just a total waste of my time.
customer_reviews.author: AMOP

customer_reviews.title: equally disappointed with second purchase as with first
customer_reviews.text: As your records indicate, this is the second Hamilton Beach food processor purchased within 12 months. The contact between the bowl lid, and base motor, enabling the processor to work, is designed to fail after about 125 to 140 uses. Hoping this deflect flaw was corrected, I spent almost $50 making the second purchase of this machine. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: mykel r

customer_reviews.title: It does what I need it to do...
customer_reviews.text: I've never had a food processor that I've loved. Still don't,lol. Too many parts that can break. I can see the lid latches that attach to the main unit breaking eventually (maybe sooner) and the top chute has a large area that i'm sure will collect food. Yes, I wash, it but I can see it collecting in those corners that no sponge or brush will reach. And, I still have to warn my husband before I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Similar Functionality to Higher Priced Food Processors
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this food processor at least once a week for well over a year now. All I can say is that for the price, this is one of the best deals out there. Though people have complained that when you process food, it's not as even texture as others at higher price points, I disagree. This processes food evenly and quickly. Also, when I purchased, I was always worried about keeping it on too long, but there is no need to worry about that with this product. I can leave it on "puree" mode for 5+ minutes at a time without worry. Overall, a fantastic purchase.
customer_reviews.author: sykobunny

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother it’s very cheap and started to smoke and spark
customer_reviews.text: This was garbage the first time I used it it had a burning smell I figured it was new finished it up cleaned it and put it away the next time same smell way more smoke and I notice what looks like sparks coming from under the buttons. I bought in July but only used it twice of course it’s past the 30 days so I didn’t bother even getting a refund just threw it in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: With a single blade, don't expect good mixing
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed.. i just used this for the first time, and it did not work well. With only a single blade, it does not mix the food well at all. It just chops at the same level, and so food above the blade doesn't get chopped, and food below the blade doesn't get chopped. What a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Holden Higginbotham

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, power, and design
customer_reviews.text: The cutting discs do not align very well with the container, allowing food to get cut only partially such that there is always some left-over. Furthermore, food gets stuck in the handle, where it is nearly impossible to clean. The build quality is also very cheap, which may be expected for the price. Overall, I had to return it as it simply wasn't feasible for long-term use and would no doubt have broken sooner or later.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Warranty not available
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use But mechanism that drives the motor broke just after a few uses Could not get through to Hamilton beach to follow up on warranty Amazon offered the option a return (too alward) or a discount which I opted for. Now trying to find a replacement bowl but it seems that this model is discontinued Do your research before buying it
customer_reviews.author: Shauna Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: Very dissatisfied. I knew I was ordering this product through Amazon Market Place and that the packaging would be banged up. When I opened the box the clamp on the lid of the processor was completely broken off (it probably won't even run if the lid won't clamp on, because it's a safety issue,) and the inside of the bowl was all scratched up. The description said the packaging only would be damaged. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Kingsley

customer_reviews.title: It’s Ok
customer_reviews.text: It’s ok. I wouldn’t buy it again if it broke. But I use it mostly to chop up cooked meat for my dog’s meal prepping. It’s a pain to clean and has weird openings in the handle that water and soap get into that is hard to get out. I can imagine that will get pretty gross and moldy after a while.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: started off great till it broke
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for about 2 months. Then I started to find plastic pieces on my countertop that I had no clue where they came from. I always washed it by hand, so it never went in the dishwasher. Fianlly one day, it just stopped working. Very disappointed with the quality. company replaced the lid. worked for another 6 months then the plastic piece broke again! What a piece of crap!
customer_reviews.author: Dave Woodward

customer_reviews.title: Truly not a good product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit six months ago and now throwing it away. The safety switch was the first to break inside the bowl so I had to bi-pass in order to use it. Did a lousy job chopping, takes a very long time to chop things like green peppers or onions, having to stop, open the bowl and scrape down the sides so many times it was faster to chop by hand. Finally the bowl came out of the dishwasher cracked, when I went on line to order a new bowl, it was $32.00! Now will order a new one and it will not be a Hamilton Beach
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it - hard to clean and LOUD
customer_reviews.text: This is loud! I wear headphones and my dog hates it. Takes forever to make stuff too. Hard to clean and food gets stuck in odd places. Would not recommend and would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Masson

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I know this might sound silly to some but I really only purchased this to crush Oreos for my cheesecakes that I make during the holidays. Crushing Oreos has always been the most time consuming task. I do not have a stand mixer. I have always used a hand mixer. Never had a food processor. Didn’t want to spend lots of money. This was perfect! I can crush lots of Oreos or graham crackers at once and this crunches it perfectly. I have tried doing veggies once but thought it cut them down too much. Like a purée. I think I just need to play around with it. Easy on and easy off!
customer_reviews.author: junebug624

customer_reviews.title: Huge disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I liked the big mouth food drop and the large bowl. I loved the fact that the blades and discs all securely storage together. But with that said...the food gets food stuck in the handleand it's tricky to remove, the slicing is mediocre. It is so uneven and made more of a mess. The slicing is okay if you don't plan on presenting or just want even slicing. The puree is okay. I was so excited to receive this and so sad it was just okay. Sadly I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Minda Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: First time that I purchase a Hamilton Beach product and so far I'm very satisfied with this food processor. I do not use it very often so therefore I couldn't tell how durable it really is, but it's not cheaply made at all. Mixes and purees food just by pulsing on and off about three times for a few seconds, it's super easy to assemble and clean, and I paid a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 5th use
customer_reviews.text: This food processor is horrendously, unnecessarily loud! It also broke after the FIFTH use. The button that usually engages to allow power to the maching when everything is in place became dislodged and would not allow the processor to turn on. Dislodging the button with a butter knife did not prevent the same problem from immediately recurring. DO NOT BUY THIS FOOD PROCESSOR! IT IS WORTHLESS!!
customer_reviews.author: Elsa C.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until it didn't
customer_reviews.text: Loved this processor for 2 1/2 yrs, used it maybe once a month to grate cheese, chop veggies or mix deviled egg filling... Light duty nothing major.. . And then one day it just would not turn on. Only giving it 2 stars because it should have lasted longer.
customer_reviews.author: Sagebrush and Beyond

customer_reviews.title: Not a great product
customer_reviews.text: Has the wide mouth but you need to have the pusher locked or you can't work the machine. Food gets stuck behind the the pusher feed and gets stuck in the the lid. You get chunks that do not grind even on a small amount so you have to remove and put it back in not a very good product
customer_reviews.author: SUSAN G.

customer_reviews.title: Plastic junk
customer_reviews.text: I agree with Sophia about the health hazard of the "safety tube". There is also the trouble of too many parts being plastic. The first one I bought from Hamilton Beach lasted at least 5 years. They discontinued that one. It was sturdier and didn't have so many plastic pieces and had been in the same price range. This one, it was barely a year before the little plastic button that shuts off the safety feature broke. Also, upon closer inspection, I see a crack starting in the center plastic piece that holds the grater blade. I only used this processor maybe once a week at most. Ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Gallegos

customer_reviews.title: What have I been missing?
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t know just how useful a food processor can be. Last week, I made the best salsa, the blade chopped the salsa to a perfect consistency. Next use was grinding meat into making my own hamburger. Combined slightly frozen cubed sirlion with frozen butter(the recipe is online) made the most perfect hamburger patties. This a superb product!
customer_reviews.author: B M

customer_reviews.title: Doubles as a blender
customer_reviews.text: Best kitchen upgrade we have made. My girlfriend loves cooking, so expanding her creation tools was a must. We chopped, minced, mashed and also made smoothies. Her sister owns an older model and it has lasted a few good years. We got ours on sale. This particular size is good for making enough mash for 4 proper servings or more. The smoothies we made was enough for two heaping tall glasses. Im sure more fit too. For quickly chopping, just tap the button a few times. As for juicing, I'm not a big juicer so I haven't tried it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 18 Months
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 18 months. Mainly used it to make Pesto...but then it randomly wouldn't work. There were no signs or anything. It just didn't work one day. Pretty bummed, but it was cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: It managed dehydrated fruit and nuts at Christmas of 2019. When I went to turn it on today, March 2020, it wouldn't even turn on. Just past warranty end of course. *sigh* Can't advise purchasing it. Have also at least once sliced my finger up on the blade just moving it to the dishwasher. Unsafe.
customer_reviews.author: D.L. Davitt

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’d give negative stars if I could. Used it just today and all throughout the use smelled burning electronics and plastic. All I was doing was shredding cheese and the motor was barely coping towards the end. This item will be sent back soon for full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Irishnotfur

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift
customer_reviews.text: I received this food processor as a gift last year and HAD to give it as a gift this year. For thanksgiving I was chosen to make the mac and cheese and you can't bring Kraft to grandmas house, but I didn't have a hand grater for all of the brick cheese I bought-- and then I remembered the food processor I was gifted came with a CHEESE SHREDDER BLADE. WHAT?! I was skeptical but let me tell you. OH BOY. This was the most beautifully grated cheese I've ever had. And the Mac turned out great. So of course, I had to gift this to the other cheese lover in my family
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: An affordable food processor....Whoopie!!
customer_reviews.text: Ive just had it for a few weeks, but so far it does what I want. I had always wanted a food processor, but the cost seemed to outweigh the benefit...this one is affordable and worth the money. Other reviewers who have had it longer recommend it highly as did a couple of the independent kitchen gadget rating services...so I am pleased with their suggestions that it is well worth the money and a "best buy."
customer_reviews.author: dagnytags

customer_reviews.title: Chef-Approved
customer_reviews.text: I've been a Chef for 20 years. After my last, gifted, food processor broke, I wanted to replace it with a non-commercial unit. I just so happened to get this on black-Friday for $32. When I unboxed the item, I was surprised at the quality of unit. It has the quality and feel of an item that I would pay OVER $100 for, easily. Pull the trigger and buy this processor.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful machine for the price. Gets the job done whether shredding carrots or grating cheeses. Just a few things I do not like: feed tube is very small, so I have to cut things smaller than I normally do; the feed chamber tends to "hop up" while the machine is running. Make sure you keep a hand over the top. There is also a place on the lid where food tends to get stuck, so a little extra cleaning is required. Still, a great machine for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use operate and clean
customer_reviews.text: Just receiving this item and I have used it 3 times. Love it. Capacity is very good, ease of opening and closing the best ever!. All old ones that were more expensive were difficult to get it just right to operate and at times in a rush was frustrating. Performs all operation well. Besides the price being great, I think I am in love with how eady it is to quickly set use then clean. Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Greenapples

customer_reviews.title: SO simple!
customer_reviews.text: In complete frustration I threw away my previous food processor because it would take me 10-20 minutes to get it all lined up properly to actually work! I’ve used this one twice and it is a DREAM! I can actually pull it out, plop in whatever I want processed, click it in place and it actually WORKS! Takes me less than a minute and no frustration or tears. The quality seems decent. I know I will use it a lot now that I have something so inuitive and simple to use and I don’t need to download the product manual to try to line it all up every time I want to use it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Becker

customer_reviews.title: Not good for shredding
customer_reviews.text: First job was to shred carrots. How hard can that be? I loaded the shute with baby carrots and turned on the unit. I pushed a small handful at a time into the unit with the plunger. Note the photo showing how the carrots just spun around on top of the shredding plate and never got shredded. The next job I did was package it back in the box and ship it back to Amazon for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: E. F. K.

customer_reviews.title: food processor
customer_reviews.text: I like the product, but it has a design flaw. Food gets stuck behind the chute, which is fairly easy to clean, but food also gets into the handle, which is impossible to clean. Not sure how to prevent it from getting in there. Considering duct tape...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Powerful !!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. Its so easy to use and is very powerful and fast. It just zips right through hard cheese too. Real easy to clean in the dishwasher. The only thing I'm a little worried about is the plastic cracking or breaking but with an extra kitchen appliance warranty, I'm not going to worry about it. I'm glad I bought this, it saves so much time in the kitchen. Good product !!! And I can grate enough cheese to last 2 or 3 meals at a time !!!
customer_reviews.author: Christene

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product.
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed, I bought this product over a month ago and I used it a few times and each time it smells like something is burning. Today I tried to use it and guess what? It is no longer working at ALl. I just wasted my money on this. I will never buy from this seller who sent me a bad quality. I cannot even return or exchange it.
customer_reviews.author: G S

customer_reviews.title: Just ok.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item, because a VERY old one that was a hand-me-down finally broke. This one does not work as well as that for shredding cheese or chicken, which is the main reason I bought it. There is a space between the edge of the lid and the chute you put food down, and food gets stuck in it every single time I use it. It's incredibly frustrating and a major design flaw, in my opinion. I will say that it is very easy to assemble though.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke B

customer_reviews.title: Was great at first
customer_reviews.text: Was great at first, but after the first wash, food and water particles got trapped inside the blade holder. The food particles have rotted. You can't get inside to clean it. It seems sour and horrible. Horrible blade holder design.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Lazenby

customer_reviews.title: I can not say enough how much I love this!
customer_reviews.text: I can not say enough how much I love this!!! I use it almost daily. It is super easy to clean and love how all attachments store inside it. Already have to many kitchen gadgets taking up drawer space. It is super big at 12 cups. I have never had to cut up veggies transfer to bowl then cut up more. Can't beat the pour spout. My pancake batter goes from being mixed to pouring right on the griddle. I would give it six stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working, no customer service support
customer_reviews.text: Bought in March 2020, stopped working Sept 2020. Won’t turn on, makes no noise, nothing. This product says there’s a 1 year warranty but Hamilton Beach customer service doesn’t respond. Very disappointed in this. I loved it when it did work.
customer_reviews.author: Ingrid Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: So far it works well. Made several batches of hummus, no power problems, it blended well. Cleaning isn't too bad, it does have some small pockets in the lid assembly that require a little effort to clean. The only real negative I can say is it's pretty loud. But, for $50 ya can't complain too much about that. It chopped a head of cabbage for some coleslaw pretty easy. I would recommend it at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Girl w/No Name

customer_reviews.title: Update
customer_reviews.text: Was very pleased with this at first. Used no more than 5 times, just for make no salsa. The buttons were very temperamental but would eventually turn on. Now it is completely dead. Won't turn on at all. It didn't die while using it, worked fine last time I used it. Took it out and it refuses to turn on at all. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Toriapvaz

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: There was a crack in the plastic rim around the bottom of the bowl when it arrived. This was a used, reconditioned processor. I was ready to use it, so I super glued the crack and put it to work. We bought this after our Hamilton Beach processor that we have had for 20 years gave out. This is more convenient to use than the old one. I hope we can get 20 years out of it.
customer_reviews.author: R. A. England

customer_reviews.title: Ordered NEW processor, RECEIVED USED processor!
customer_reviews.text: This food processor is listed as NEW, However, it is clearly not! The bottom has scratches, the cutting blade is marked and clearly used. There are smudges on the metal that don't wipe off. Totally grossed out by the condition of this item. I'm returning my order!! Check yours carefully to make sure ALL parts are new!
customer_reviews.author: SE

customer_reviews.title: IT IS POWERFUL
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it once and I used it for blending up worm food. There was old waffles, egg shells, coffee grounds and some squash. My other food processor was okay but small. This one is so much more powerful. I really like that it is so easy to put together and use. Hope this helps:)
customer_reviews.author: Christopher K.

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I suppose the reason that it is so inexpensive is because it does have some issues. We shred a lot of cheese and cheese would get caught in the lid. The parts also rattled when the machine was turned on. And after just 5 months (probably only a dozen uses) an internal piece broke off. One that is part of the safety feature and is necessary for the machine to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Cuts and chops lots large quantities easily
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this unit! We purchased it to replace an aging food processor and picked this one due to a combination of good ratings and inexpensive price point. We've diced vegetables, made bread crumbs, standard stuff - this unit has handled everything we've asked it to do very well. It has plenty of capacity in the 12 cup processor and seems to have plenty of horsepower to chop up stuff. I'd buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Big Blue Fan

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Has been working perfectly so far, please be careful blades are REALLY sharp, I cut my hand & didn’t even know I was cut because I didn’t feel it, until I seen the blood. Great product, though.
customer_reviews.author: Vrizzy Prater

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: Loved it while it lasted. The plastic piece that enables and disables the safety stop broke after 5 months of having the food processor, and I only used it a handful of times. Really disappointed with the quality considering Hamilton beach is usually pretty good. Obviously can't return it, and they don't sell just the lid, so looks like I have to purchase another one.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working within 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I feel disappointed that this product for which I had a lot of faith turned out to be so bad. Even the customer service to whom I reached out 3 times, wouldn't get back to me, making the warranty useless. Eventually, I had to buy a similar product from another company which was half the price and had great service.
customer_reviews.author: Kam

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this processor. I was looking for a quick fix until my other one arrived. First the base was light as a toothbrush. 2- it wouldn’t crush my cooked yellow carrots and I barely had anything in it. I couldn’t get it to chop my cooked rabbit (my dog food) either. Blades are to low. So back it went.
customer_reviews.author: Fit4life

customer_reviews.title: I looked at some other brands but in the end I really liked the size of this one the ease of use
customer_reviews.text: Had been looking at replacing my old food processor that the blade broke in (it too was a Hamilton Beach) and I was unable to get a new blade for it because it was so old. The machine still worked but wasn't of much use since the blade I used the most was broken. I looked at some other brands but in the end I really liked the size of this one the ease of use, the wide mouth and the easing stacking. It works great! and Looks Great!
customer_reviews.author: N. Denise Caffey

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I am very careful with my appliances Hand washed and did not machine wash after use and dried thoroughly Unfortunately used twice to pulse fresh tomatoes and just stopped no power at all Did not abuse or try to grind anything hard so not abused at all very poor performance
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is terrible. Everything gets mashed and stuck to the lid. You’re better off just chopping everything on a cutting board and saving the mess 🙄
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Powerful; Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This is my first food processor and I love it. I found it very easy to clean by hand. I noticed some people had issues with food sticking to the blade or in crevices. I used the "Pulse" feature on dates and they stuck to the blade and around the bottom of the container. I decided to treat it the same way my mom would clean the blender back in the 1970's. I filled the container halfway with water and added a tablespoon of dish soap. Then, I used the pulse feature for several minutes- cleaned up perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca & Deane Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: The food processor was not very impressive. The power is great however chops were uneven. Sometimes bits and pieces don't get picked up and get stuck around the bottom of the large chute. Overall the it's big, bulky, and not as sleek as some of the other brands out there. Also feels unsturdy and cheap. However it's cheap and you get what you paid for.
customer_reviews.author: E C.

customer_reviews.title: Works great but does not include scraper
customer_reviews.text: Hmm, looks like I misread something and It doesn't come with the scraper piece 🤔 and I'm unable to contact the seller. So I have to stop and scrape down the sides a lot but other than that it's a really good product!
customer_reviews.author: Shaina Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Joining the stopped working group
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought me this as a gift on April 24, 2020. Today is September 8, 2020 and it stopped working. No groaning. No smoke. Nothing. $60 bucks down the drain. It was great have a food processor however, it might be a blessing in disguise as I read the reviews about black mold and food poisoning from the machine. Amazon, get rid of this machine!
customer_reviews.author: C. L. Warner

customer_reviews.title: I love this food processor!
customer_reviews.text: It works like a charm and I can throw it in the dishwasher. My roommate was enthralled when I used the attachment to shred cheese. She wants one now! The only detail I wish was better, water (or maybe food gunk?) got into one of the little safety areas with a spring, and that looks kind of gross. Not sure how to clean that out. But, I still love the product and I've used it for several things.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Food Processor
customer_reviews.text: I love this food processor! I bought it because I make a lot of pie crusts during the holidays and it has made my life much easier. I've also used it to make bread crumbs, finely ground nuts, cookies, and crackers. This powers through it all and does a great job slicing as well. I'm so happy I didn't pay over $100 for one of the overpriced ones. This one does exactly what I need it to.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Mattei

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware, Used Only ONCE
customer_reviews.text: I used this food processor ONE time. I only did a single cup of almonds to make with a sauce, washed it, and stored it. I went to use it the other day to do some tomatoes (it had been untouched since the previous use) and it does not turn on at all! I don't have a broken piece of plastic or metal or anything to show like I have seen in some of the other reviews but it is really and truly broken. I am very perplexed and disappointed. I would not recommend this product. :(
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: A leaking mess! At first I thought it was missing a ring to prevent it from leaking- nope, it is a design defect. It leaked and went down into the handle. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Adequate for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this a few months now and although it arrived with a crack in the base of the bowl, it still worked so I jus kept it. It’s fine, easy to take apart which I appreciate. It seems to be ok at most processing chores I have, not great at pesto though but fine. For the price it’s perfectly adequate
customer_reviews.author: Amy Mueller

customer_reviews.title: A Big Help In The Kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Have used this food processor several times since receiving this product from about 3 weeks ago. It's been used for slicing cheese and deli meats for lunches, chopping vegetables for soup, slicing baked boneless chicken breasts for sandwiches, dicing and blending vegetables for salsa. I read in reviews before, that if filled too full, container would leak. While making salsa, container was not filled completely to top and there was no leakage. Processor made the task of finely cutting, shredding and chopping very minimal. A big helper for the cook.
customer_reviews.author: JO

customer_reviews.title: Sucks fo cleaning
customer_reviews.text: Chunks of food you cannot get to get stuck in not only the handle but also in the safety tube on the bowl part.... Seriously who puts HOLES where small bits of food, and God forbid CHEESE get stuck and you cannot take it apart to clean it!?.....
customer_reviews.author: james m johnson

customer_reviews.title: IT WILL DIE.....SOON
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on 12/10/17. It died today, 9/11/18. I used it maybe 12 times. It is not worth the cheap price. All I'm doing is adding to our landfill. Next time, I will just throw the money in the trash instead of purchasing a Hamilton Beach product - it will take up less room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Hamilton Beach 12-Cup Stack & Snap Food Processor & Vegetable Chopper, Black (70725A)
product_meta.description:
Designed to be uniquely simple, The Hamilton Beach stack & snap 12 cup food processor requires no twisting, turning or locking during assembly. Instead, it’s as easy as stacking the 12 cup bowl onto the base, then snapping on the lid. Easy to use - Disc attachments are reversible and labeled, which takes the guesswork out of processing. The label should face up for the desired function. When using disc attachment, do not process foods past the max level indicator on the bowl.

FOOD MAXIMUM AMOUNTTO PROCESS
Dry ingredients such as crackers or nuts 12 cups (2.8 L)
Vegetables or fruits 3 pounds (1.4 kg)
Cheese such as Parmesan or Cheddar 40 ounces (1.2 L)
Thick sauces or dips 8 cups (1.9 L)
Liquids such as marinades or soups 7 cups (1.7 L).
feature_bullets: Prep the freshest ingredients: A powerful 450 watt motor and 2 speeds plus pulse control save you time and money
Simple to assemble and use: Stack and snap design requires no difficult twisting or locking; A simple function guide is printed on the food processor for ease of use
12 cup capacity: Sealed bowl helps prevent leaks when mixing liquids; Dimensions (inches) 16.25 H X 9.55 W X 8.76 D; BPA free in all food zones
Stainless steel blades: S-blade and reversible slice/shred disc chop, slice, shred, mix and puree just about anything
Large feed chute: Big mouth feed chute fits whole foods for quick, easy processing and less prep time
Simple function guide shows you which blade to use and which button to press

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars7,063 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
